item.title: ICYM AI & ML - Week #28 of 2016
item.description:
Articles

  • Teaching an AI to write Python code with Python code
  • Understanding LSTM Networks
  • Starting DL with Jupyter
  • DIY Deep Learning for Vision: a Hands-On Tutorial with Caffe
  • Wide & Deep Learning: Better Together with TensorFlow - Can we teach computers to learn like humans do, by combining the power of memorization and generalization?

Papers

  • Mastering the Game of Go with Deep Neural Networks and Tree Search. Basically: * Values networks to evaluate board positions and policy networks to select moves. * Trained with supervised learning from human expert games and reinforcement learning from games of self-play. * NN playS Go at the level of state-of-art Monte-Carlo tree search that simulate thousands of random games of self-play. * New search algorithm that combines Monte-Carlo simulation with value and policy network

  • Adversarial Examples in the Physical World

Talks

  • Deep Residual Networks, Kaiming He, Facebook AI Research
  • AlphaGo Preso
  • Prof. Jürgen Schmidhuber - True Artificial Intelligence Will Change Everything

Yolo

  • Remember: "All games of perfect information have an optimal value function which determines the outcome of the game".

  • Post-Rock as it best: Ghost Lanes
item.dc:creator: Marina von Steinkirch
